ygData.subject: Re: Padding fitness?
ygData.msgSnippet: I did see that parameter, but I interpreted it as the maximum species age - period.  What you describe certainly makes more sense. -- Chris

I did see that parameter, but I interpreted it as the maximum species age -=
 period.  What you describe certainly makes more sense.


-- Chris


--- In=
 neat@yahoogroups.com, "Ken" <kstanley@...> wrote:
>
> 
> 
> That's correct=
, squaring fitness will increase the chance of something in a local maximum=
 being chosen.  However, it might also cause search to focus more on more p=
romising areas, so it's a trade-off.  There isn't generally one setup that =
is best for all problems.
> 
> Note that in some versions of NEAT there is =
something called a "species dropoff age," which will cause a species to be =
penalized if it has not improved in some number of generations (the dropoff=
 age).  That can help to eliminate those who are stuck.
> 
> ken
